title: Giorgi Lomaia
text:
Giorgi Lomaia (, born 8 August 1979 in <a href="Tbilisi">Tbilisi</a>) is a retired <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Career.
He spent the 2006 season playing for <a href="Russian%20Premier%20League">Russian Premier League</a> side <a href="FC%20Luch-Energia%20Vladivostok">FC Luch-Energia Vladivostok</a>, but in late January 2007 he moved to <a href="Germany">German</a> <a href="2.%20Fu%C3%9Fball-Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> side <a href="FC%20Carl%20Zeiss%20Jena">FC Carl Zeiss Jena</a> on a short-term deal until the end of the 2006–07 season. He left Jena in June 2007 and joined <a href="FC%20Karpaty%20Lviv">FC Karpaty Lviv</a> in <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>.
He made his debut for the <a href="Georgia%20national%20football%20team">Georgian national team</a> in 1998 and has been capped 25 times for the team as of 2006. In July 2007 Lomaia was loaned from <a href="FC%20Carl%20Zeiss%20Jena">FC Carl Zeiss Jena</a> to <a href="Ukraine">Ukrainian</a> side <a href="FC%20Karpaty%20Lviv">FC Karpaty Lviv</a>. Having played two matches in <a href="Lviv">Lviv</a>, Lomaia departed due to the club's dissatisfaction with his physical conditions.
International career.
In International football, Lomaia has been the first choice goalkeeper in <a href="UEFA%20Euro%202008%20qualifying">UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying</a> with seven appearances.
In <a href="2006%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28UEFA%29">2006 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)</a>, he took the first choice place from <a href="Akaki%20Devadze">Akaki Devadze</a>.
In <a href="UEFA%20Euro%202004%20qualifying">UEFA Euro 2004 qualifying</a> with eight appearances, he took the first choice place from <a href="Davit%20Gvaramadze">Davit Gvaramadze</a>.
Personal.
He is the brother of <a href="Davit%20Lomaia">Davit Lomaia</a>.
